answers.answer: My personal advice to patients with your combination of problems----do not have multifocal IOLs put in their eyes. Just read all the problems with multifocal IOLs here, for diabetics problems occur in Spades.Also know that cataract surgery even successful surgery increases the risk of your diabetic retinopathy progressing. So don't have surgery until its a BIG problem. After cataract surgery have your retina ophthalmologist check you for increase retinopathy at least every six months for several years.JCH III MD

question: I am 53 years old with type 1 diabetes for 45 years.  I am a runner and work in a job that requires several hours of computer work each day.  25 years ago I had laser surgery for diabetic retinopaphy in both eyes.  Now I have a cataract in my left eye that has made it hard to see in bright light or read small print or drive at night.  (The right eye is not as impaired)  I want and need to have near intermediate and far vision.  Will the Restore or Rezoom lens work for me?  Will the scar tissue from my previous laser surgery be a problem?Thank you.
title: Are Restore and Rezoom options for me?
